Rationale: According to the landscape in the given image: there are two blue standing meeples on two different incomplete roads, two blue farmers in two different fields: both of them having 2 connected cities connected to them, One red standing meeple on an incomplete Road, one red farmer: in the field that is connected to three complete cities. According to the rules of the game: 1)Each of the monasteryâ€™s tiles (the 8 surrounding tiles and the one with the monastery itself) is worth 1 point 2) Each tile in the completed city is worth 2 points. Each field is worth 3 points per adjacent completed city that the farmer is a part of. If the right player chooses tile A,  the best way to gain points using the style is to place the tile in the hollow part of the landscape adjacent to the one below the tile containing the blue farmer;  then please the red maple on top of the monastery; this would result in the monastery feature to complete and therefore giving the red player nine points. If the red player chooses Tile B, The best way to get maximum points from the style would be to place the tile below the tile containing the red farmer; and then place the red meeple on top of the city component of the tile; this would result in the completion of the city feature (2 tiles) with the red maple on it giving that player Four Points.
